thread.title: IRD leaves Wellington office amid quake damage fears
thread.title_full: IRD leaves Wellington office amid quake damage fears

author: Matt Stewart
title: IRD leaves Wellington office amid quake damage fears
text:
IRD leaves Wellington office amid quake damage fears MATT STEWART Last updated 17:08, February 8 2017 Where's safe in the next big earthquake? Not again ‘Murky science’ Not a drill Invasive testing 
Staff have left another Wellington CBD building, as the repercussions of November's magnitude 7.8 earthquake keep rolling in. 
Inland Revenue spokesman Pete Van Schaardenburg said all 495 staff at the department's building in Hawkestone St were told to leave about 4pm on Tuesday. 
Two floors of the 11-storey building require propping as a precautionary measure, after invasive testing. Maarten Holl 
IRD staff have left their building at 12 Hawkestone St in Wellington's CBD while further strengthening work is carried out. 
The Kids' Reserve childcare centre on the ground floor has chosen to stay, as tests showed its floor was structurally sound. 
READ MORE: * IRD Wellington headquarters closed over suspected quake-struck stairwell 
The building had been put on a Wellington City Council list of 80 buildings that needed further checks and invasive testing. 
Van Schaardenburg said engineers had reported on the checks and raised concerns related to the pre-cast concrete on some floors. 
"Staff safety is a top priority, so the decision was made to evacuate and close the building while remediation work is carried out," he said. 
Decisions on where to temporarily relocate these staff in the interim would be made in the coming days. Is the IRD building on Hawkstone St (just across from the late 61 Molesworth St) the latest building to be evacuated due to #EQNZ damage?
